text: How similar do templates need to be so that you can swap them out and preserve modules inside flexible columns? I'm started to get more clients who want to swap out templates and am not 100% sure of the rules. In the case below there's a different module in the top flexible column and I'd like it to copy over - it's a custom module with a lot of information:
name the flex columns in the NEW template to be the same as the old template
and also a recommendation, always use content staging to swap templates, then if something screws up you can always delete the staged version and try again.
Template swapping even if you name the columns consistent isn’t always perfect. I’ve still had some oddball situations where modules ended up in weird places but most of the time it’s just fine

It's still not working unfortunately - I just checked in content staging :disappointed: I've been lucky up until now that people just wanted a new template going forward, or swapped one or two, but I have a couple of clients now with many hundreds of LPs.

yeek yea, been in your boat, but with a client that had been cloning the original template every time they created a new page.(made it really hard to properly do, we had a lot of people just recreating the pages in the new template because it was faster in that instance)

I think the possible gotcha with your templates are the fact the name of one of the flex columns in the original is the default flex column name.

You could try renaming that, then renaming the equivalent column in your new template and see if it helps

I pitched an idea for this feature a long long time ago that never seemed to get traction-

When swapping templates, HubSpot would first try to map the flex columns, and then it would display a little UI for dragging the modules to the correct flex columns if it wasn’t certain
Yeah, I think I found that and upvoted it a couple of days ago. Maybe someday!
